page.title: 02Grampound Road and Ladock
page.content: Grampound Road expanded with the arrival of The Great Western Railway when a station was opened in 1859. The closure of the station in 1963 placed its future in jeopardy but the past 20 years have seen dormitory expansion and development of light industry. Today there are 2 pubs, a Post Office, 2 shops, a garage, a wood store, a building site and 2 factories. Ladock grew up beside the river and main road. There has been no major housing development since the Council houses at Trethurffe were built in 1970. It is now classed as a Non- development village. There is only one shop with a Post Office and a pub. The nearest doctors are at Probus which is 2 miles from either village. Shops, banks etc are at Truro or St.Austell but big department stores are at Plymouth 50 miles away.
